title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe an economic benefit that the river likely provided in the year 2007 but not after 2008, such as any of the following:

title: Part E

title: Part F
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe one way that farmers could protect the aquifer recharge zone shown in the diagram, such as any of the following:

· They could encourage use of organic farming or GMO MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaqGhbGaaeytaiaab+eaaaa@3882@ or IPM MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaqGjbGaaeiuaiaab2eaaaa@3885@ methods to reduce pesticide/nutrient pollution to the aquifer in the recharge zone.

· Implement restrictions on how much water could be pumped from the aquifer for irrigation.

· Use drip irrigation to prevent runoff entering recharge zone.

· Encourage planting of riparian buffers to block nutrients from reaching recharge zone.

· They could encourage purchasing the land in conservation easements to prevent development that would increase pollutants and impervious surfaces on the recharge zone.

· They could encourage use of organic farming or GMO MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaqGhbGaaeytaiaab+eaaaa@3882@ or IPM MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaqGjbGaaeiuaiaab2eaaaa@3885@ methods to reduce pesticide/nutrient pollution to the aquifer in the recharge zone.

· Implement restrictions on how much water could be pumped from the aquifer for irrigation.

· Use drip irrigation to prevent runoff entering recharge zone.

· Encourage planting of riparian buffers to block nutrients from reaching recharge zone.

· They could encourage purchasing the land in conservation easements to prevent development that would increase pollutants and impervious surfaces on the recharge zone.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe how the planting of a variety of native grasses in grazing pastures that grow in different conditions is a sustainable approach for grazing beef cattle, such as any of the following:

· The mix of perennial native grasses will enable the cattle to graze on grass growing at several seasons: cool and warm season grasses.

· Native grasses would be more drought resistant than non-native grasses, reducing the need for irrigation.

· Native grasses would be better adapted to the soil quality/environment than non-native grasses, reducing the amount of fertilizer/pesticide needed.

· Allows for cover crop to be present year-round, preventing erosion.

· Variety of native plants reduces the risk to loss of forage material for cattle from disease.

The response describes how the planting of a variety of native grasses in grazing pastures that grow in different conditions is a sustainable approach for grazing beef cattle, such as one of the following:

· The mix of perennial native grasses will enable the cattle to graze on grass growing at several seasons: cool and warm season grasses.

· Native grasses would be more drought resistant than non-native grasses, reducing the need for irrigation.

· Allows for cover crop to be present year-round, preventing erosion.

· Variety of native plants reduces the risk to loss of forage material for cattle from disease.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe one environmental problem wetland ecosystems may experience because of the increased need for agricultural land for crops or beef production, such as any of the following:

· Many wetlands may be drained and filled to serve as cropland, leading to loss of habitat.

· Wetlands may be contaminated with herbicides/pesticides/manure/fertilizers (leading to eutrophication).

· Deforestation of swamps or mangroves to be used as agricultural land would lead to loss of habitat.

· Deforestation of swamps or mangroves to be used as agricultural land would lead to loss of habitat
